dmca.title: AUP/TOS Violation [67.15.42.210] Case #: 10806
dmca.body:
t

 

________________________________

From: Derric Wood [mailto:derwood2005@hotmail.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, January 31, 2007 8:55 AM
To: dmcahouston; Legal Response
Subject: RE: AUP/TOS Violation [67.15.42.210] Case #: 10806

 

 

Sub:        AUP/TOPS violation [67.15.42.210] Case #: 10806

 
Escalation # 1400730


Sir
 
This is in reference to your e-mail dated 30.01.2007.

 

 In regard to your e-mail we wish to submit as under: -
 
That in the URL there is no violation by way of any unauthorized use of
trademarked material owned by LILLY ICOS. The Trademark of the Lilly
ICOS is "CIALIS" or "GENERIC CIALIS". In the website pages, we are
neither using the trademark CIALIS or GENERIC CIALIS.
                
Upon receipt of your e-mail, we again in order to assure ourselves
verified the contents of our website in the entire website no such
trademark have been used.
 
In the website there were independent links (of web-sites which are
neither owned nor controlled by AllDayChemist) which were there on
reciprocal basis, which were provided by us in good faith. By way of
abundant precaution we have removed those link sites from our website
and we will also not be offering Tadalafil (or any product containing
Tadalafil for consumption to visitors from the United States. The same
has been conspicuously stated on the related pages.
 
From the aforesaid it is clear that there is no content, which is to be
removed or which is in anyway using  the trademarked material owned by
LILLY ICOS. 
 
We wish to bring to your notice that we are traders who are selling
products of reputed companies who manufactured their goods in India
after obtaining necessary licenses from the concerned drug authorities
in India. Apparently the products being sold by us are licensed and are
not counterfeit as alleged.
 
We hope that the aforesaid submissions sufficiently satisfy your
queries. If however you have any other query, the same may be addressed
to us, which we will be duly replying.
 
Thanking you

 

ANUJ BHARGAVA
 
 





________________________________

> From: dmca@ev1servers.net
> To: derwood2005@hotmail.com
> CC: 
> Subject: AUP/TOS Violation [67.15.42.210] Case #: 10806
> Date: Tue, 30 Jan 2007 17:59:55 -0600
> 
> Dear Customer:
> 
> It has come to our attention that your server located at
[67.15.42.210] is in violation of our AUP/TOS by way of the following
URL(S): http://www.alldayalchemist.com/ 
> 
> The URL(S) stated above is in violation by way of unauthorized use of
trademarked materials owned by Lilly ICOS. 
> 
> At this time we must demand that you take prompt action in the removal
of the Content in question or we will be forced to take further action.
The time is now 1/30/2007 5:59:53 PM. As of this email you have 48 hours
remaining
> 
> To better serve you please login to the members section and update the
trouble ticket in reference to this email. Thank you in advance for your
prompt cooperation. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Relevent Definitions and/or Terms :
> The Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (DMCA) requires immediate
removal of the infringing material, upon proper DMCA notification, which
we have received. Due to this we require immediate removal of said
infringing items. For your convenience in the instance that the
infringing material is controlled by your client we have given you the
above time frame to remove the infringing material. If you or your
client feels that this notice is in error and wish to dispute the notice
of claimed infringement, you will need to provide us with a
Counter-Notification. You may learn more about filing a
Counter-Notification at
http://www.loc.gov/copyright/legislation/dmca.pdf. Once we are provided
with the Counter-Notification, we will provide you with instructions on
how to proceed, until then the infringing material must be inaccessible.
Prior to filing a Counter-Notification or you feel this notification is
in error let us know so that we may provide you with the original
notification.
> 
> Users may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or
otherwise store on a Server, The Planet Network or its physical
infrastructure any information, data, material, or work that infringes
the intellectual property rights of others or violates any trade secret
right of any other person. The Planet has the right to disable access
to, or remove, infringing content to the extent required under any law
or regulation, including the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998.
For your convenience, information concerning procedures for making
claims of copyright infringement for purposes of Title 17, Section 512,
of the United States Code is contained at the Legal section of our
website.
>
